DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Closest Surgical Margin Deep Distance Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a value in centimeters indicating the measured length between a malignant lesion of the colon or rectum and the border of tissue removed in surgery relatively farthest in or toward center of the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Closest Surgical Margin Deep Distance
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the space between the nearest border of a malignant lesion of the colon or rectum and the border of tissue removed in cancer surgery relatively farthest inward or toward center of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:Indicating the one of several that is the shortest distance away.:The edge or border of the tissue removed in cancer surgery.  The margin is described as negative or clean when the pathologist finds no cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has been removed.  The margin is described as positive or involved when the pathologist finds cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has not been removed.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.
Indicating the one of several that is the shortest distance away.

One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Property.preferredDefinition: Extending relatively far inward.:The space between two objects or points.

Concepts.definition: The space separating two objects or points.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric value indicating the measured length or distance between a malignant lesion of the colon or rectum and a border of tissue removed during cancer surgery.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Use caBIG Representation Term Measurement based on NCIt concept
